item.title: Microsoft now enforces MFA on Azure Portal sign-ins for all tenants
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft says it has been enforcing multifactor authentication (MFA) for Azure Portal sign-ins across all tenants since March 2025. [...]

item.title: EU fines Google $3.5 billion for anti-competitive ad practices
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The European Commission has fined Google €2.95 billion ($3.5 billion) for abusing its dominance in the digital advertising technology market and favoring its adtech services over those of its competitors. [...]

item.title: Financial services firm Wealthsimple discloses data breach
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Wealthsimple, a leading Canadian online investment management service, has disclosed a data breach after attackers stole the personal data of an undisclosed number of customers in a recent incident. [...]

item.title: Max severity Argo CD API flaw leaks repository credentials
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: An Argo CD vulnerability allows API tokens with even low project-level get permissions to access API endpoints and retrieve all repository credentials associated with the project. [...]

item.title: Microsoft gives US students a free year of Microsoft 365 Personal
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Microsoft announced that starting this Thursday, all college students in the United States can get a free year of Microsoft 365 Personal. [...]

item.title: Don’t let outdated IGA hold back your security, compliance, and growth
item.dc:creator: Sponsored by tenfold Software
item.description: Identity Governance & Administration (IGA) is critical to keeping data secure, ensuring only the right people have access to the right resources. But legacy IGA is slow, costly, and code-heavy. Learn from tenfold why Modern IGA solutions deliver faster out-of-the-box integrations, streamlined governance, and built-in compliance. [...]

item.title: Critical SAP S/4HANA vulnerability now exploited in attacks
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: A critical SAP S/4HANA code injection vulnerability is being leveraged in attacks in the wild to breach exposed servers, researchers warn. [...]

item.title: Hackers exploited Sitecore zero-day flaw to deploy backdoors
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Threat actors have been exploiting a zero-day vulnerability in legacy Sitecore deployments to deploy WeepSteel reconnaissance malware. [...]

item.title: Texas sues PowerSchool over breach exposing 62M students, 880k Texans
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: Texas Attorney General Ken Paxton has filed a lawsuit against education software company PowerSchool, which suffered a massive data breach in December that exposed the personal information of 62 million students, including over 880,000 Texans. [...]

item.title: Chess.com discloses recent data breach via file transfer app
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: Chess.com has disclosed a data breach after threat actors gained unauthorized access to a third-party file transfer application used by the platform. [...]

item.title: New TP-Link zero-day surfaces as CISA warns other flaws are exploited
item.dc:creator: Bill Toulas
item.description: TP-Link has confirmed the existence of an unpatched zero-day vulnerability impacting multiple router models, as CISA warns that other router flaws have been exploited in attacks. [...]

item.title: France slaps Google with €325M fine for violating cookie regulations
item.dc:creator: Sergiu Gatlan
item.description: The French data protection authority has fined Google €325 million ($378 million) for violating cookie regulations and displaying ads between Gmail users' emails without their consent. [...]
